page.title: 20THE ENTERPRISE ZONE .
page.content: This is an area of land adjacent to the River Tyne which has been set aside for{industrial and commercial {development,}in the hope that the rate-free location,government grants and the provision of services will encourage the establishment of light industry and so ease the problem of unemployment in the distric Stretching east to west across the area,the zone centres upon land once used for the dumping of fly ash slurry from the {Dunston B Power Station}. Work began on clearing the site in 1984 and it is expected that a large shopping and recreational complex, including a watersports area will be completed by the end of the decade. The development will be called the {MetroCentre.
